paragraphs.content: Chapter 1
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 1

paragraphs.content: Now it came to pass after the death of Saul, when David was returned from the slaughter of the Amalekites, and David had abode two days in Ziklag;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Now it came to pass after the death of Saul, when David was returned from the slaughter of the Amalekites, and David had abode two days in Ziklag;

paragraphs.content: It came even to pass on the third day, that, behold, a man came out of the camp from Saul with his clothes rent, and earth upon his head: and so it was, when he came to David, that he fell to the earth, and did obeisance.
paragraphs.contentHtml: It came even to pass on the third day, that, behold, a man came out of the camp from Saul with his clothes rent, and earth upon his head: and so it was, when he came to David, that he fell to the earth, and did obeisance.

paragraphs.content: And David said unto him, From whence comest thou? And he said unto him, Out of the camp of Israel am I escaped.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And David said unto him, From whence comest thou? And he said unto him, Out of the camp of Israel am I escaped.

paragraphs.content: And David said unto him, How went the matter? I pray thee, tell me. And he answered, That the people are fled from the battle, and many of the people also are fallen and dead; and Saul and Jonathan his son are dead also.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And David said unto him, How went the matter? I pray thee, tell me. And he answered, That the people are fled from the battle, and many of the people also are fallen and dead; and Saul and Jonathan his son are dead also.

paragraphs.content: And David said unto the young man that told him, How knowest thou that Saul and Jonathan his son be dead?
paragraphs.contentHtml: And David said unto the young man that told him, How knowest thou that Saul and Jonathan his son be dead?

paragraphs.content: And the young man that told him said, As I happened by chance upon mount Gilboa, behold, Saul leaned upon his spear; and, lo, the chariots and horsemen followed hard after him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And the young man that told him said, As I happened by chance upon mount Gilboa, behold, Saul leaned upon his spear; and, lo, the chariots and horsemen followed hard after him.

paragraphs.content: And when he looked behind him, he saw me, and called unto me. And I answered, Here am I.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And when he looked behind him, he saw me, and called unto me. And I answered, Here am I.

paragraphs.content: And he said unto me, Who art thou? And I answered him, I am an Amalekite.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he said unto me, Who art thou? And I answered him, I am an Amalekite.

paragraphs.content: He said unto me again, Stand, I pray thee, upon me, and slay me: for anguish is come upon me, because my life is yet whole in me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He said unto me again, Stand, I pray thee, upon me, and slay me: for anguish is come upon me, because my life is yet whole in me.

paragraphs.content: So I stood upon him, and slew him, because I was sure that he could not live after that he was fallen: and I took the crown that was upon his head, and the bracelet that was on his arm, and have brought them hither unto my lord.
paragraphs.contentHtml: So I stood upon him, and slew him, because I was sure that he could not live after that he was fallen: and I took the crown that was upon his head, and the bracelet that was on his arm, and have brought them hither unto my lord.

paragraphs.content: Then David took hold on his clothes, and rent them; and likewise all the men that were with him:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then David took hold on his clothes, and rent them; and likewise all the men that were with him:

paragraphs.content: And they mourned, and wept, and fasted until even, for Saul, and for Jonathan his son, and for the people of the LORD, and for the house of Israel; because they were fallen by the sword.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And they mourned, and wept, and fasted until even, for Saul, and for Jonathan his son, and for the people of the Lord, and for the house of Israel; because they were fallen by the sword.

paragraphs.content: ¶ And David said unto the young man that told him, Whence art thou? And he answered, I am the son of a stranger, an Amalekite.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ And David said unto the young man that told him, Whence art thou? And he answered, I am the son of a stranger, an Amalekite.

paragraphs.content: And David said unto him, How wast thou not afraid to stretch forth thine hand to destroy the LORD’s anointed?
paragraphs.contentHtml: And David said unto him, How wast thou not afraid to stretch forth thine hand to destroy the Lord’s anointed?

paragraphs.content: And David called one of the young men, and said, Go near, and fall upon him. And he smote him that he died.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And David called one of the young men, and said, Go near, and fall upon him. And he smote him that he died.

paragraphs.content: And David said unto him, Thy blood be upon thy head; for thy mouth hath testified against thee, saying, I have slain the LORD’s anointed.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And David said unto him, Thy blood be upon thy head; for thy mouth hath testified against thee, saying, I have slain the Lord’s anointed.

paragraphs.content: ¶ And David lamented with this lamentation over Saul and over Jonathan his son:
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ And David lamented with this lamentation over Saul and over Jonathan his son:

paragraphs.content: (Also he bade them teach the children of Judah the use of the bow: behold, it is written in the book of Jasher.)
paragraphs.contentHtml: (Also he bade them teach the children of Judah the use of the bow: behold, it is written in the book of Jasher.)

paragraphs.content: The beauty of Israel is slain upon thy high places: how are the mighty fallen!
paragraphs.contentHtml: The beauty of Israel is slain upon thy high places: how are the mighty fallen!

paragraphs.content: Tell it not in Gath, publish it not in the streets of Askelon; lest the daughters of the Philistines rejoice, lest the daughters of the uncircumcised triumph.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Tell it not in Gath, publish it not in the streets of Askelon; lest the daughters of the Philistines rejoice, lest the daughters of the uncircumcised triumph.

paragraphs.content: Ye mountains of Gilboa, let there be no dew, neither let there be rain, upon you, nor fields of offerings: for there the shield of the mighty is vilely cast away, the shield of Saul, as though he had not been anointed with oil.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Ye mountains of Gilboa, let there be no dew, neither let there be rain, upon you, nor fields of offerings: for there the shield of the mighty is vilely cast away, the shield of Saul, as though he had not been anointed with oil.

paragraphs.content: From the blood of the slain, from the fat of the mighty, the bow of Jonathan turned not back, and the sword of Saul returned not empty.
paragraphs.contentHtml: From the blood of the slain, from the fat of the mighty, the bow of Jonathan turned not back, and the sword of Saul returned not empty.

paragraphs.content: Saul and Jonathan were lovely and pleasant in their lives, and in their death they were not divided: they were swifter than eagles, they were stronger than lions.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Saul and Jonathan were lovely and pleasant in their lives, and in their death they were not divided: they were swifter than eagles, they were stronger than lions.

paragraphs.content: Ye daughters of Israel, weep over Saul, who clothed you in scarlet, with other delights, who put on ornaments of gold upon your apparel.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Ye daughters of Israel, weep over Saul, who clothed you in scarlet, with other delights, who put on ornaments of gold upon your apparel.

paragraphs.content: How are the mighty fallen in the midst of the battle! O Jonathan, thou wast slain in thine high places.
paragraphs.contentHtml: How are the mighty fallen in the midst of the battle! O Jonathan, thou wast slain in thine high places.

paragraphs.content: I am distressed for thee, my brother Jonathan: very pleasant hast thou been unto me: thy love to me was wonderful, passing the love of women.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I am distressed for thee, my brother Jonathan: very pleasant hast thou been unto me: thy love to me was wonderful, passing the love of women.

paragraphs.content: How are the mighty fallen, and the weapons of war perished!
paragraphs.contentHtml: How are the mighty fallen, and the weapons of war perished!
